docs.abstract: Two critics debate their (opposite) views of the smartwatch’s newest model.
docs.snippet: Two critics debate their (opposite) views of the smartwatch’s newest model.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Apple came crashing into the smartwatch market in 2015 with its unambiguously named “Watch.”

headline.main: The Apple Watch Series 5. A Love or Hate Relationship.
headline.print_headline: The Apple  Watch 5:  Love or hate

byline.original: By Robin Swithinbank and Timothy Barber

docs.abstract: “The Banker,” one of the tech giant’s first forays into film, was a day away from its premiere at AFI Fest in Los Angeles.
docs.snippet: “The Banker,” one of the tech giant’s first forays into film, was a day away from its premiere at AFI Fest in Los Angeles.
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple canceled the premiere of “The Banker,” starring Samuel L. Jackson, on Wednesday, yanking the movie from its prestigious closing-night Thursday slot at the American Film Institute’s annual festival in Los Angeles.

headline.main: Apple Pulls Samuel L. Jackson Movie From Festival, Citing ‘Concerns’
headline.print_headline: Apple Scuttles Premier of ‘The Banker,’ Citing ‘Concerns’

byline.original: By Nicole Sperling and Julia Jacobs

docs.abstract: The president suggested that a trade deal with China remains some distance off, but said he would “look into” Apple receiving exemptions from more tariffs.
docs.snippet: The president suggested that a trade deal with China remains some distance off, but said he would “look into” Apple receiving exemptions from more tariffs.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said on Wednesday that China had not yet made enough concessions to secure a trade deal with the United States and suggested that he might exempt Apple from an upcoming round of tariffs as he toured a Texas plant that assembles Mac Pro computers.

headline.main: Trump Floats Tariff Exclusions for Apple at Texas Manufacturing Plant

docs.abstract: President Trump said on Wednesday that he opened a facility that makes computers for Apple. It’s been operating since 2013.
docs.snippet: President Trump said on Wednesday that he opened a facility that makes computers for Apple. It’s been operating since 2013.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump on Wednesday toured a Texas plant that makes high-end Apple computers, chatting with Apple’s chief executive, Timothy D. Cook, and accepting a plate with the words “Assembled in USA.”

headline.main: No, That Mac Factory in Texas Is Not New

docs.abstract: President Trump didn’t rule out exempting Apple from tariffs, while the company’s C.E.O., Tim Cook, stood in silence as the president made inaccurate claims about the firm.
docs.snippet: President Trump didn’t rule out exempting Apple from tariffs, while the company’s C.E.O., Tim Cook, stood in silence as the president made inaccurate claims about the firm.
docs.lead_paragraph: Charles Schwab is reportedly in talks to buy TD Ameritrade in a $26 billion deal that could be announced as early as today. (Want this by email? Sign up here.)

docs.abstract: Margrethe Vestager won praise for her oversight of the tech industry. Now, with more authority from the European Union, she envisions a more aggressive agenda.
docs.snippet: Margrethe Vestager won praise for her oversight of the tech industry. Now, with more authority from the European Union, she envisions a more aggressive agenda.
docs.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Margrethe Vestager spent the past five years developing a well-earned reputation as the world’s top tech industry watchdog. From her perch overseeing Europe’s competition rules, she fined Google more than $9 billion for breaking antitrust laws, and forced Apple to pay about $14.5 billion for dodging taxes.

headline.main: Big Tech’s Toughest Opponent Says She’s Just Getting Started
headline.print_headline: Silicon Valley’s Biggest Foe Is Getting Even Tougher

byline.original: By Adam Satariano and Matina Stevis-Gridneff

docs.abstract: The move of entrepreneurs, engineers and venture investors away from the consumer internet and to enterprise software has piqued regulator interest.
docs.snippet: The move of entrepreneurs, engineers and venture investors away from the consumer internet and to enterprise software has piqued regulator interest.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Rajiv Ayyangar and two other Yahoo alumni explored start-up ideas, they experimented with concepts directed at the public, like a personal finance app. But making money from consumers was too daunting, they concluded, partly because of the tight grip that digital giants like Google and Apple had over distribution.

headline.main: With Big Tech in Their Path, Start-Ups Turn to Business Markets
headline.print_headline: Steering Clear of Big Tech By Innovating for Business

byline.original: By Steve Lohr and Erin Griffith

docs.abstract: Some workers may be more exposed to artificial intelligence than previously thought. But worry more about automation’s threat to less skilled employees.
docs.snippet: Some workers may be more exposed to artificial intelligence than previously thought. But worry more about automation’s threat to less skilled employees.
docs.lead_paragraph: Each week, we review the week’s news, offering analysis about the most important developments in the tech industry.

headline.main: The Week in Tech: A.I.’s Threat to White-Collar Jobs

docs.abstract: Once a generation, Hollywood experiences a seismic shift. It is happening again.
docs.snippet: Once a generation, Hollywood experiences a seismic shift. It is happening again.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Every three decades, or roughly once a generation, Hollywood experiences a seismic shift. The transition from silent films to talkies in the 1920s. The rise of broadcast television in the 1950s. The raucous “I Want My MTV” cable boom of the 1980s.

headline.main: The Streaming Era Has Finally Arrived. Everything Is About to Change.
headline.print_headline: The Streaming Era Has Finally Arrived.  Everything Is About to Change.

docs.abstract: We keep stumbling across examples of discrimination in algorithms, but that’s far better than their remaining hidden.
docs.snippet: We keep stumbling across examples of discrimination in algorithms, but that’s far better than their remaining hidden.
docs.lead_paragraph: Each week, we review the week’s news, offering analysis about the most important developments in the tech industry.

headline.main: The Week in Tech: Algorithmic Bias Is Bad. Uncovering It Is Good.
headline.print_headline: Uncovering Biased Algorithms Is Better Than the Alternative
